description.narrative: By 2025, out of school girls and boys, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations access education and skills development programmes.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Ethiopia (Learning and Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Ethiopia: Formative evaluation of UNICEF Ethiopia Country Program Evaluation Report
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, out of school girls and boys, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations access education and skills development programmes.

Service Delivery - Number of children/adolescents studying primary education through alternative modes of delivery (formal or non formal, e.g. evening school, weekend school, distance learning) with support from UNICEF
